results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, introducing "Transition Network Analysis (TNA)" as a novel method.
Section 3.1, 'Implementation of the method', provides a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including data coding, Markov model estimation, and clustering.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available.
While no data is shared, there is no explicit justification for why the data cannot be shared.
Table 1 serves as a data dictionary, explaining the coding scheme for chat discussions, including variables and descriptions.
The document describes the data collection methods: "students had to collaborate together online using chats...The students' online chat discussions were collected and coded..."

The document states: "We also present a case study where we use TNA to study group regulation to showcase the method's potentials...We estimated the Markov model using the R packages tna [19] and seqHMM [12, 37]" and mentions an R package [19].
While the R packages are mentioned, the code itself is not directly shared or linked.
The document does not explicitly mention or share code for data preparation, only the packages used for Markov model estimation.
Statistical tests (e.g., Kappa for reliability, BIC for cluster selection) and models (Markov models, Stochastic Process Mining) are clearly described.
Effect sizes (e.g., Kappa > 0.61), confidence intervals, and p-values (e.g., p < 0.01 for covariate analysis) are reported.
The analysis is primarily quantitative; subjective context and interpretation are limited.
The document focuses on quantitative analysis and does not include detailed descriptions of qualitative data coding or analysis.
Results are presented with figures (e.g., Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4, Figure 5, Figure 6, Figure 7) and tables (e.g., Table 1, Table 2) and are clearly described in the text.
Section 4.6, 'Limitations', discusses limitations related to sample size, Markov model assumptions, and network complexity.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
